entry.title: Two-Tier ERP - Cloud ERP Release 2508
entry.content:
We’re excited to share the latest scenarios as part of Two-Tier ERP strategy with the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release. With these new additions, two-tier ERP continues to empower organizations with scalable, agile, and cost-effective ERP solutions that seamlessly integrate headquarters and subsidiaries across diverse business scenarios.

      

Let's go through the highlights of the new innovative scenarios from the space of Supply chain planning, Plant maintenance and Finance which are relevant for the large enterprises with Discrete Industry.

Integrated Business Planning with IBP 

This scenario enables synchronized demand planning between Headquarters and subsidiaries using historical sales data, statistical forecasting, and real-time collaboration to optimize the consolidated plan for procurement and inventory management from the headquarters. IBP uses the historical sales orders data from both the headquarters and subsidiaries and generates statistical forecasted demand based on various forecasting algorithms. The planners in subsidiaries can adjust this local forecasted demand based on special events, promotions etc. and generate a final consensus demand which is then translated to headquarters as Planned Independent Requirements (PIRs) for centralized procurement/production.

 

For details Please refer to the blog post written by my colleagues Kavyanshi and Kangkana:   Two- Tier ERP: Demand Planning with SAP IBP for Headquarter - Subsidiary model

Equipment Refurbishment with Sales & Services Integration 

Two-Tier ERP solution for the process of Equipment Refurbishment with sales & services integration. The two scenarios support seamless refurbishment workflows for leased or rented equipment across Headquarters and subsidiaries, ensuring efficient maintenance, asset tracking, and customer service.  Here are the two possible use cases, 

Scenario 1: Headquarters leases out a high value equipment to the subsidiary on lease basis for a particular time with subsidiary paying monthly rents and spending on equipment maintenance. There is an equivalent lease-in contract at the subsidiary with automatic creation of asset master and manual creation of Equipment master. During Asset maintenance in case the equipment needs refurbishment, it is sent to headquarters for Refurbishment. 

 

Scenario 2: customer places a contract with the subsidiary for an equipment. Equipment is delivered to the customer as a consignment and updated in master as equipment at customer location. The parameters or indicators are maintained in the equipment master. The subsidiary is informed of the repair or service required with the customer and equipment details. Monthly rentals are charged against the contracts for the period equipment is at customer location. Between the customer and subsidiary, vendor invoicing is done for the service or repair carried out on the equipment. The subsidiary decides if the equipment needs repair or refurbishment during annual equipment maintenance through service order. In case of repair, in-house repair is carried out at subsidiary and in case of refurbishment, the damaged equipment is sent to headquarters for Refurbishment with headquarters sending the replaced equipment back to customer via subsidiary. 

 

Please refer to the blogpost written by my colleague Vijayalaxmi : Two-Tier: Refurbishment with Service - SAP Community

Building a Treasury Workstation 

This feature brings in multiple Innovations in Cash and Liquidity Management ensure smooth operation of a treasury workstation in a distributed system environment, enabling data workflows between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private /ECC systems, including Bank Account Management, Cash-Flow and TRM accounting documents.   

   

                                              

Capabilities

  • Two-tier treasury management: accounting document integration routing
  • Bank account unique IDs for cross-system management
  • More Forecasted Flows Supported for Cash-Flow Reconciliation with End-of-Day Bank Statements

​Value Proposition

  • Streamlined operations
  • Improved data traceability and reliability
  • Safeguarded scenarios where the treasury workstation assumes the role of single source of truth for bank account master data
  • Reduced implementation efforts and operational costs for customers and partners who deploy treasury management in the cloud system
  • Enhanced Cash-Flow Replication: both push and pull features are enabled for cash flow replication

entry.title: Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

 

Hello Everyone,

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Sourcing and Procurement line of business continues to evolve, bringing forward innovations that empower procurement professionals to operate with greater agility, transparency, and collaboration. This release focuses on enhancing core procurement processes, integrating intelligent technologies, and improving user experience across the board. Let’s take a closer look at the key updates and how they support your procurement transformation journey.

 

For other releases please see here. Check out all demos in a playlist here.

Operational Procurement

  • Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header
  • Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow
  • Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval
  • Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow
  • V4 API for intracompany stock transfer
  • Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes
  • Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App
  • Extensibility in manage source lists app
  • Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

  • Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

SAP Arabia Central Procurement

  • Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts
  • Procurement Expansion Package

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header

The integration of the Document Management System (DMS) at the header level of purchase requisitions marks a significant improvement in how procurement teams manage documentation. Professional purchasers can now attach relevant documents directly to requisitions, with the ability to classify them for internal or external use. While external classification will be supported in future updates, the current functionality already streamlines documentation processes and ensures consistency across SAP Fiori applications such as “Manage Purchase Requisition – Professional” and “Create Purchase Requisition – Advanced.” This enhancement simplifies audit trails, improves traceability, and fosters better collaboration between procurement teams and stakeholders.

 

For more information, see: Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional

Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow

Procurement workflows often require flexibility, especially when exceptional circumstances arise. The introduction of ad-hoc approvers allows authorized users to dynamically add individuals to a workflow instance based on the context of a specific purchase order. This capability ensures that critical decisions are not delayed due to rigid approval chains. The ability to designate multiple ad-hoc approvers and track their involvement in the approval history adds a layer of transparency and responsiveness, making procurement processes more agile and context-aware.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Orders 

Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval

SAP has introduced a reviewer step in purchase order workflows, allowing designated users to monitor workflow progress and provide feedback without having approval authority. This feature is particularly valuable for organizations that require compliance checks, financial oversight, or legal reviews before finalizing purchases. By enabling user-based or role-based recipient selection and allowing deadline settings, SAP ensures that the review process is both structured and adaptable. This innovation enhances governance and fosters a collaborative approach to procurement decision-making.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow

The ability to use account assignment categories—such as Internal Order, Asset, and Sales Order—as workflow triggers provides organizations with granular control over procurement approvals. These categories can now be defined as start conditions for purchase order workflows, allowing organizations to tailor approval processes based on financial responsibility and operational context. Additionally, step conditions can be configured to assign specific individuals responsible for each category, ensuring that approvals are targeted and relevant. This supports better financial stewardship and operational alignment.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

 

V4 API for intracompany stock transfer

SAP’s introduction of a new OData V4 API for intracompany stock transfers enables external applications to create, read, update, and delete stock transport orders in real time. This API-driven approach supports seamless integration with external systems, facilitating efficient stock movement across organizational units and enhancing data accuracy. The inclusion of error messaging ensures that invalid data is promptly flagged, reducing the risk of discrepancies and improving overall inventory control.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Stock Transport Order (CE_STOCKTRANSPORTORDER_0001) and Stock Transport Order (OData V4)

Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes

Supplier collaboration is enhanced through the automatic integration of supplier confirmation notes into purchase orders. When suppliers provide notes during the confirmation process, these are now automatically transferred to the corresponding purchase order and its items. This ensures that supplier input is accurately captured and reflected throughout the procurement lifecycle. By reducing manual data entry and minimizing the risk of miscommunication, this feature improves order accuracy and strengthens supplier relationships.

 

For more information, see: Manage Supplier Confirmations

Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App

Project-based procurement receives a boost with the inclusion of account assignment category Q (project stock) in the Manage Purchase Contract app. This enables organizations to handle make-to-order scenarios with greater precision, including the management of fields such as WBS elements and GL accounts. By extending support to project procurement, SAP empowers industries like construction, engineering, and manufacturing to align purchasing activities with project timelines and budgets.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Contracts

Extensibility in manage source lists app

The Manage Source List app has been enhanced to support custom fields, allowing users to store business-specific information that aids in sourcing decisions. Previously, the app did not permit the addition of custom fields, limiting its flexibility. With the new capability, users can define fields of various types—such as string, date, and decimal—and manage them using provided BADIs. This extensibility supports tailored data management and improves the efficiency of source list maintenance.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Source Lists and Overview of Changes in Extensibility Objects

Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

Financial transparency is further improved with the ability to view pending invoice values distributed across account assignment splits in purchase order items. When a purchase order item is assigned to multiple cost objects, such as cost centers or internal orders, users can now monitor the open invoice amount proportionally per assignment line. This granular visibility supports accurate accruals, budget tracking, and financial reporting, enabling organizations to maintain tighter control over their expenditures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Purchase Order Items by Account Assignment 

Procurement Expansion Package

The Procurement Expansion Package (PEP) consolidates advanced operational procurement features, catalog content channels, and supplier network capabilities into a single offering. Designed for SAP Cloud ERP customers, PEP delivers comprehensive spend coverage, improved compliance, and enhanced supplier collaboration. It supports a consumer-grade shopping experience, touchless supplier interactions, and end-to-end visibility across procurement processes. By digitizing manual transactions and centralizing procurement data, PEP helps organizations achieve greater efficiency, transparency, and strategic value.

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

Tax compliance is a critical aspect of procurement, and SAP addresses this through integration with external tax engines like Vertex and Thomson Reuters in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management. This integration allows for the calculation, verification, and validation of VAT, GST, and other transaction taxes on supplier invoices. By automating tax determination and comparison with supplier-provided data, organizations can prevent overpayments, mitigate compliance risks, and enhance audit readiness. The ability to specify commodity codes and use address data for tax calculation further refines the accuracy of this process.

 

 

For more information, see: Verification of Tax Applied to a Supplier Invoice

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Procurement

Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts

Central procurement capabilities have been expanded in two key areas. First, the activation of single-line distribution within central contracts allows organizations to generate individual outline agreements for each contract line item. This is particularly beneficial for industries such as automotive, where scheduling agreements often require single-item configurations. Second, when copying a central contract, users can now edit fields such as supplier and purchasing organization, providing greater flexibility in contract lifecycle management and enabling smoother transitions when suppliers change.

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

Education & Research in the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release

The 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP continues to advance digital transformation for (Higher) Education and Research institutions by delivering innovations that enhance operational agility, financial transparency, and research excellence.

A key highlight of this release is the broader international rollout of public sector functionality, including Grants Management, and Budget (Funds) Management,  now available in ten additional countries. This reflects a growing global shift toward modern, cloud-based ERP systems capable of supporting advanced budget and funding models and increasing compliance requirements in the academic and research landscape.

This release also aligns with two major technology trends reshaping the sector: the move toward composable ERP architectures and the deepening integration of AI. Institutions can now take advantage of even more embedded intelligence for real-time decision support. In parallel, enhanced extensibility through SAP Business Technology Platform and API-first design enables tailored solutions for research administration, staff services, and financial operations.

Whether managing a growing research portfolio, aligning budgets with institutional strategy, or driving operational efficiency, the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release offers a robust and future-ready platform!

In this blog, we explore what’s new in the 2508 release for (Higher) Education and Research, including finance, grants, analytics, and localization updates, as well as how these new capabilities support institutions on their journey to an agile institution.

Denmark, Finland, France, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Norway, Saudi Arabia, Spain, and Sweden

Position budgeting with funds pre-commitments and budget availability check

  • Enable financing of positions with their corresponding funding sources, such as funds, grants, or functional areas, and monitoring and control of budget consumption
  • Create earmarked fund precommitments in SAP Cloud ERP to reserve the position budget
  • Finance vacant positions

Benefits

Enable accurate budget monitoring and control of personnel expenses by allowing the financing of positions in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Features

When a new employment gets created in SAP SuccessFactors, based on the employment costs, the necessary budget gets reserved in SAP Cloud ERP through an earmarked funds document of type commitment document. When an employee gets hired in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, based on the salary of the employee, the budget gets reserved in the SAP Cloud ERP system through an earmarked funds document, of type Commitment document. During every payroll run for the employee, the existing commitment document gets adjusted with the corresponding payroll actuals amount, and the corresponding actuals document is created and posted in the SAP Cloud ERP.

  • You can finance employees in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central by using Position Budgeting Control for Cloud. The financing uses information from the funds commitment amount in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Position Budgeting Control for Cloud allows you to ensure that employees are sufficiently budgeted for a specified financial period.
